subject: Payment of respect of Price Escalation
text: #Tr 7rflv TTAIf gfaror Phone 91-11-25074100/2574200 Fax 91-11-25093507/25093514 (Ag6 7Rar7 3r 7TTTnf TaT) Extn. 2223/2318/2468/2553 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport & Highways) G-5 & 6, Sector-10_ Dwarka New Delhi-110075 NHAIF&A/Policy Matter/2003/210 August 07, 2004 POLICY MATTERS-ADMINSTRATIONFINANCE 88/2004) [Decision taken on Finance Division File No. NHATF& A/Policy Matter/2003/210] Sub: Payment_in_respect of Price Escalation Kindly refer to policy circular (85/2004) of even no. dated May 20, 2004 vide which the procedure was prescribed recovery of payments released in respect of price escalation under those contracts (in particular, contracts in respect of projects under Kolkata-Chennai section of GQ) where the provisions had been worded din ifferently in respect 0/ payment of escalation 0n all components of works except variations evaluated at present rte. In this regard, para 3 of the aforesaid policy circular is substituted aS under: "3. In view of the above; it has been decided that- No further payment on account of price escalation may be made under these contracts where it is not found in the express language  (ii) As regards recovery of payments o account of price escalation released in the case of the projects that have already been completed, the recovery may be made immediately with interest at SBI PLR as stipulated in the policy circular (49/2003) (iii) Payments already released on account of price escalation; which are not secured against Bank Guarantees, may be recovered immediately with interest at SBI PLR as stipulated in policy circular (49/2003). However; in case the contractors request NHA] to allow them to secure such payments against Bank Guarantees; such requests may be acceded to by the Project Directors. (iv) The entire payments made on account of price escalation; including the payments released earlier which were not secured against Bank Guarantees but have nowv been secured Bank Guarantees [refer para (iii) above], may be recovered in suitable installments with   interest at SBI PLR as stipulated in the policy circular (49/2003),  subject to the conditions that the entire recovery is made before 90% of the final contract value has been for_ This issues with the approval of the Chairman: [V.K.
